    Logistics RegressionÂ¶

    BackgroundÂ¶

    åœ¨äºŒåˆ†ç±» 0-1 é—®é¢˜. Y éšæœºæœä» the binomial distribution.

    $$ Y âˆ¼B(p(X,tilde Î²)),quadbegin{cases}P(Y =1|X)=p(X,tilde Î²)\ P(Y =0|X)=1âˆ’p(X,tildeÎ²)end{cases}\ begin{align*} E(Y|X)&=1*P(Y=1|X)+0*P(Y=0|X)\ &=p(X,tildebeta) = P(Y=1|X) end{align*} $$

    How to build $p(X, tilde beta)$? æ—¢ç„¶ Y æœä»è¿™ä¹ˆä¸€ä¸ªäºŒé¡¹åˆ†å¸ƒï¼Œé‚£ä¹ˆ $p(X,tildebeta)$ æ˜¯ä»€ä¹ˆï¼Ÿå¾ˆæ˜¾ç„¶å®ƒæ˜¯å…³äºä¸€ä¸ª X çš„å‡½æ•°ï¼ŒåŒæ—¶it is characterized by a custom $beta$. So roughly speaking, itâ€™s like we have a set of X, but the event happens with a certain probability and this probability can be captured by a function of X and the function of X is also characterized by sudden beta.

    ğŸ’¡ : æœ€ç®€å•çš„ linear regressionï¼Œä½†

    ||linear regression|$p(X,tildebeta)$è¦æ±‚| Logistic Regression| |--|â€“|--|â€“| |1ï¸âƒ£ å–å€¼èŒƒå›´|infinity to infinity|$\in[0,1]$|Sigmoid| |2ï¸âƒ£ output|continuous|categorical|Thresholdã€based on LSMã€‘|

    LR çš„è§’åº¦Â¶

    SigmoidÂ¶

    ==Logistic Function(Sigmoid)==ã€‚ $y=cfrac{1}{1+e^{-x}}begin{cases}limlimits_{xrightarrow-infin}=0\limlimits_{xrightarrow+infin}=1end{cases}$

    $logcfrac{p}{1-p}=a+X^Tbeta\implies p(X,tildebeta) =cfrac{exp(a+X^Tbeta)}{1+exp(a+X^Tbeta)},tildebeta=(a,beta)$

    • why Sigmoid? æˆ‘ä»¬æƒ³ map the continuous output space into a new ç¦»æ•£çš„ categorical çš„ output spaceã€‚ æˆ‘ä»¬è‡ªç„¶æƒ³åˆ°äº† unit-step Function å•ä½è·ƒè¿å‡½æ•°ã€‚ä½†æ˜¯å•ä½è·ƒè¿å‡½æ•°ä¸è¿ç»­ä¸å¯å¾®ã€‚æ‰€ä»¥æˆ‘ä»¬åˆå¾€å‰èµ°äº†èµ°ï¼Œæƒ³åˆ° <u>Sigmoid Function (Så‹å‡½æ•°ï¼Œåœ¨æœºå™¨å­¦ä¹ ç‰¹æŒ‡ Logstic Function)</u>ã€‚ è‡³äºä¸ºä»€ä¹ˆè¦ä½¿ç”¨ Sigmoid å‡½æ•°ä¸­çš„å¯¹æ•°å‡ ç‡å‡½æ•°ï¼Œè¿™æ¶‰åŠåˆ°ä¼¯åŠªåˆ©åˆ†å¸ƒçš„æŒ‡æ•°æ—å½¢å¼ï¼Œæœ€å¤§ç†µç†è®ºç­‰

    <figure class=â€spanâ€>![](./pics/LogR_1.png)<p> add sigmoid</p></figure>

    æ‰€ä»¥ A regularized Regressionï¼š Linear Regression + LSM -ã€‹ Logistic Regression + 0.5

    threshold Î±Â¶

    !!! p â€œBased on LSM.â€

    ==Least Minimum Method==ã€‚$mathcal{L}_i=Vert Y_i-f(X_i,theta)Vert^2,$ with target : condition Mean $E{Y|X}$

    in classification : $small E{Y|X}=P{Y=1|X}$

    å°±æ˜¯è¯´è¿™ä¸ª estimation çš„ç”Ÿæˆçš„ estimator å…¶å®å°±æ˜¯E{Y|X}ï¼Œåœ¨åŒç­‰æ¦‚ç‡çš„01äºŒåˆ†ç±»é‡Œçš„ meaning æ˜¯ label=1 çš„æ¦‚ç‡ï¼Œæ‰€ä»¥æˆ‘ä»¬å°† threshold å®šä½0.5ã€‚ä½†æ˜¯å½“ä¸æ˜¯ä¸¤è€…ä¸æ˜¯åŒç­‰æ¦‚ç‡ï¼Œå°±éœ€è¦ä½¿ç”¨ ==MLE==è¿›è¡Œä¼°è®¡

    $$hat{y}=begin{cases}0&P{Y=1|X}<0.5\1&P{Y=1|X}>0.5end{cases}$$

    ContentÂ¶

    ==Logistic Regression==. $$P(Y=1|X)=p(X,tildebeta) =cfrac{exp(a+X^Tbeta)}{1+exp(a+X^Tbeta)},tildebeta=(a,beta)$$

    æå¤§ä¼¼ç„¶è§’åº¦å»ä¼°è®¡Â¶

    $begin{cases}P(Y = 1|X = X_i) = p(X_i,tildeÎ²),\ P (Y = 0 | X = X_i ) = 1âˆ’p( X_i , tildeÎ² )end{cases}xrightarrow{text{unified as}}$ $$P(Y=Y_i|X=X_i)={p(X_i,tildebeta)}^{Y_i}{1-p(X_i,tildebeta)}^{1-Y_i}$$

    å½“æ ·æœ¬ç‹¬ç«‹ + $tildebeta=(1 ,beta_1,dots,beta_p)$

    the likelihood function $L(tilde Î²) = prodlimits_{i=1}^n p(X_i,tilde Î²)^{Y_i}{1âˆ’p(X_i,tilde Î²)}^{1âˆ’Y_i}$

    log-likelihood function $l(tilde Î²)=log L(tilde Î²) = sumlimits_{i=1}^n {Y_itildebeta^Ttilde X_i-log(1+exp(tildebeta^Ttilde X_i))}$

    Using MLE, $hatbeta = maxlimits_{tildebeta} mathcal{L}(tildebeta) = minlimits_{tildebeta} -l(tildebeta)$

    compared with Linear RÂ¶

    ==Linear R==$. Y=X^Tbeta+redepsilon=beta_0+beta_1X_1+dots+beta_pX_p+redepsilon$ ==Logistic==. $mathbb E(Y|X)=X^Tbeta=beta_0+beta_1X_1+dots+beta_pX_p$ Logistic regression does not have error Îµ, but Linear regression. Logistic ä¸æ˜¯ç”¨é¢„æµ‹å‡å€¼åŠ ä¸€ä¸ªè¯¯å·®é¡¹å¯¹Yçš„æ¯ä¸ªå€¼è¿›è¡Œå»ºæ¨¡ï¼Œè€Œæ˜¯ç®€å•åœ°å¯¹é¢„æµ‹å‡å€¼è¿›è¡Œå»ºæ¨¡ï¼Œæ¢è¨€ä¹‹æ˜¯åœ¨ç»™å®šå€¼Xå¤„çš„å‡å€¼ã€‚è¿™æ˜¯å›å½’çº¿ä¸Šçš„å€¼ã€‚

    |æ¯”è¾ƒ|Linear R<br>$y=X^T\beta+\epsilon$ | Logistic R| |--|â€“|--| |Q|å›å½’|åˆ†ç±»| |å»ºæ¨¡çš„è§’åº¦|æµ‹Yçš„æ¯ä¸ªå•ç‹¬å€¼ | åªé¢„æµ‹å¹³å‡å€¼ $P(Y=1\|X)$| |ä»è®¡ç®—çš„è§’åº¦è¯´|$\mathbb{E}\epsilon = 0$| $p(X,tildebeta)=P(Y=1|X)=mathbb{E}(Y|X)$| |å‚æ•°ä¼°è®¡æ–¹æ³•|æœ€å°äºŒä¹˜æ³•MSE|æå¤§ä¼¼ç„¶æ³•MLE|
